meanings.definition: To remove or extract (something) from a living organism.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon will be explanting the tumor from the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The gardener is explanting the weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was explanting the seeds from the tomato like a surgeon.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was explanting a burden from her heart when she finally spoke up.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully explanted the ancient artifact from the ground.

meanings.definition: The act of removing or extracting something from a living organism.
meanings.sent1: The explanting of the tooth was necessary to relieve the pain.
meanings.sent2: The explanting of the foreign object from the patient's body was successful.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper described the explanting of the venom from the snake as a delicate procedure.
meanings.sent4: The explanting of the idea from her mind left her feeling relieved.
meanings.sent5: The explanting of the fish from the tank was done with great care.
